A-B Calmoverken i Målilla 24, disponent där fr. 37, deläg. o. styrrled. där samt i A-B Bruzaholm^s bruk, A-B Ringdiesel i Sthlm, A-B K. A. Eriksson i Mariannelund. Led. av komm:-fullm. sed. 32, tax:nd 3i2-39, nämndeman 32-38. Res. i de skand. länderna, B^lticum o. Tyskl. Hobby: jakt.
translated: Alm, Erik Gustav Hjalmar, manager, Målilla station, born on December 23, 1899 in Hultsfred, Kalmar County, son of the industrialist C. A. A. and Emma Frans'son. He attended trade school and technical school. He worked as an engineer at A-B Calmoverken in Målilla in 1924 and became manager there in 1937, and was also a co-owner and board member of A-B Bruzaholm's mill, A-B Ringdiesel in Stockholm, and A-B K. A. Eriksson in Mariannelund. He was a member of the municipal assembly since 1932, and a member of the tax assessment committee from 1932-1939, and a lay judge from 1932-1938. He enjoyed hunting and traveled frequently to the Scandinavian countries, the Baltic area, and Germany.
